<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 279, 171, 290]]<|/det|> # PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 280, 904, 290]]<|/det|> 9702/41 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 380, 311]]<|/det|> Paper 4 A Level Structured Questions <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 904, 312]]<|/det|> October/November 2018 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 322, 904, 333]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 341, 415, 353]]<|/det|> Candidates answer on the Question Paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 361, 367, 372]]<|/det|> No Additional Materials are required. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 394, 388, 405]]<|/det|> # READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 420, 718, 432]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 325, 446]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 449, 503, 461]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 463, 504, 475]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 477, 380, 488]]<|/det|> DO **NOT** WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 504, 256, 514]]<|/det|> Answer **all** questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 359, 541]]<|/det|> Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 766, 556]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 605, 581]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 758, 596]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 124, 87]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 102, 666, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass unit \(1u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81\mathrm{ms}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 167, 88]]<|/det|>
## Formulae

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 108, 555, 145]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 163, 520, 179]]<|/det|>
\[W = p\Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 194, 532, 223]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 236, 520, 252]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 265, 555, 297]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V}\langle c^2\rangle\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 305, 536, 321]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 340, 600, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_0\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{({x_0}^2 - x^2)}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 380, 528, 415]]<|/det|>
\[f_0 = \frac{f_s\nu}{\nu\pm\nu_s}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 428, 533, 460]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_0r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 469, 622, 488]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_1 + 1 / C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 501, 590, 520]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_1 + C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 532, 522, 555]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 570, 525, 587]]<|/det|>
\[I = Anvq\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 604, 590, 622]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_1 + R_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 638, 622, 656]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_1 + 1 / R_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 668, 512, 702]]<|/det|>
\[V_{H} = \frac{BI}{ntq}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 715, 553, 732]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_0\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 748, 574, 765]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_0\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 777, 530, 812]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_1}\]

The Moon may be considered to be a uniform sphere with a diameter of \(3.5 \times 10^{3} \text{km}\) and a mass of \(7.4 \times 10^{22} \text{kg}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 459, 918, 492]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 506, 918, 539]]<|/det|>

<form>minimum speed = .................................................... $\text{ms}^{-1}$ [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 692, 873, 708]]<|/det|>
At point P, the gas has volume \(950 \text{cm}^3\), pressure \(2.10 \times 10^5 \text{Pa}\) and temperature \(280 \text{K}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 723, 917, 755]]<|/det|>
The gas is heated at constant volume and 97.0J of thermal energy is transferred to the gas. Its pressure and temperature change so that the gas is at point Q on Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 770, 917, 802]]<|/det|>
The gas then undergoes the change from point Q to point R and then from point R back to point P, as shown on Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 845, 90]]<|/det|> 
Some energy changes that take place during the cycle PQRP are shown in Fig. 2.2.

change P → Qchange Q → Rchange R → P
thermal energy transferred to gas/J+97.00....................
work done on gas/J....................-42.5+37.0
increase in internal energy of gas/J............................................................

change P → Qchange Q → Rchange R → P
thermal energy transferred to gas/J+97.00....................
work done on gas/J....................-42.5+37.0
increase in internal energy of gas/J............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 374, 917, 406]]<|/det|>
<pre>The column of liquid is displaced so that the change in height of the liquid in each arm of the U-tube is \(x\), as shown in Fig. 3.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 420, 918, 452]]<|/det|>
<pre>The liquid in the U-tube then oscillates with simple harmonic motion such that the acceleration \(a\) of the column is given by the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 457, 550, 492]]<|/det|>
<pre>\[a = -\left(\frac{2g}{L}\right)x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 496, 434, 513]]<|/det|>
<pre>where \(g\) is the acceleration of free fall.

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 320, 915, 352]]<|/det|>
Two parallel metal plates A and B are situated a distance \(1.2 \text{cm}\) apart in a vacuum, as shown in Fig. 6.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[250, 362, 740, 597]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 612, 532, 630]]<|/det|>
<pre>Fig. 6.1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 645, 606, 662]]<|/det|>
Plate A is earthed and plate B is at a potential of \(-75 \text{V}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 676, 765, 692]]<|/det|>
A helium nucleus is situated between the plates, a distance \(x\) from plate A.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 707, 647, 723]]<|/det|>

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 738, 917, 785]]<|/det|>
The helium nucleus is free to move between the plates. By considering energy changes of the helium nucleus, explain why the speed at which it reaches plate B is independent of the separation of the plates.

<mark>[2]

<label>(ii)</label>

As the helium nucleus ( \(^4_2\) He) moves from plate A towards plate B, its distance \(x\) from plate A increases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 117, 917, 134]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[514, 339, 917, 356]]<|/det|>
<form>speed = ............................................................ $\text{ms}^{-1}$ [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 840, 90]]<|/det|>
An ideal operational amplifier (op-amp) has infinite bandwidth and infinite slew rate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 348, 120]]<|/det|>
State what is meant by
